intro: Pasaccardoa jeffreyi subsp. kasaiensis, commonly known as the Kasai dwarf lily, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences of pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it produces small, fleshy berries that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
